dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 3281 IH: National Agricultural Research, Extension, and Teaching Policy Act of 1977
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Figures (for himself, Ms. McClellan, Ms. Sewell, Mrs. Foushee, Mr. Thompson of Mississippi, Mr. Johnson of Georgia, Mr. Ivey, Mr. Fields, Ms. Kelly of Illinois, Mr. David Scott of Georgia, and Ms. Kamlager-Dove) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture, and in addition to the Committee on Education and Workforce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To prohibit the reduction, elimination, or suspension of funding for land-grant colleges and universities.

section.header: Prohibition on reduction, elimination, or suspension of funding for land-grant colleges and universities

subsection.text: The Secretary of Agriculture, or any other Federal official, may not take any action to reduce, eliminate, or suspend funding for land-grant colleges and universities, unless such reduction, elimination, or suspension is specifically authorized by an Act of Congress.

In this section, the term land-grant colleges and universities has the meaning given such term in section 1404 of the National Agricultural Research, Extension, and Teaching Policy Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3103).
